data.text:
The Hotel is in a central location about a block off Las Ramblas so the location is not that safe but ideal because it is central. That is all that it has going for. We encountered numerous problems that made our stay, not an ideal one. These are some of the issues we encountered:

1. On our first night, the shower flooded causing water to spill every where. There was 
     over an inch of water which we did not realize was flooding.
2. The shower faucet was broken and twisted a finger trying to open and close it
     A. The only really nice Hotel staff member with great customer service was Oscar
           He changed our room to a similar one. He was always very friendly, genuine 
           and nice to us when ever we encountered him. (It was a pleasure for us meeting 
           and speaking with him)
3. Unfortunately the other room also had extremely slow drains so we had to be extra 
     careful, not to slip and fall in the semi flooded shower. 
4. The sinks, if not paying attention, would overflow. Additionally, the smell of mold 
     would come up from the sinks after use
5.  The other issue was television did not work (in the whole hotel) for the 4 nights we 
       stayed. The response was always (Technician is working on this)
6. We tried their breakfast, and not only was the food and quality very poor but for 
      the content, expensive
7. For a hotel that advertises as a 4 star hotel, the bed/mattress equates to the 
    comfort of a hostel. The most uncomfortable bed for we have experienced
8. Fixtures in the room like the vents seemed like they were going to fall off
9. Aside from Oscar, the rest of the Hotel staff do not seem to be happy working 
    there. And the perception is that they  are very unhappy and do not want to be 
    bothered. 

So our advise, is really look for another hotel elsewhere in Barcelona until this hotel can fix these issues and really becomes a 4 Star Hotel.
data.title: Hotel That Advertises as 4 Star Hotel When In Reality It Is More Like a 2.5 Star Hotel

data.text:
We had a wonderful visit to Barcelona and our stay at Hotel Espana was certainly one of the reasons. Our room was not luxurious, but it was clean and well taken care of with a very comfortable bed.
What really stood out was the staff who provided incredible service and hospitality. They were kind and attentive and clearly knew what they were doing.
The hotel is very well located to explore the Gothic Quarter and is just steps from the subway.
We would happily return.
data.title: A lovely, well located hotel

data.text:
We had a great stay and would return.

The staff were very friendly and looked after us very well. We were given a voucher for a cocktail at the rooftop area as well!

The hotel itself is clean and well decorated. Our room was very nice and the AC was nice after coming in from the heat.

The pool area is nice (albeit the pool is quite small). 

I am surprised at some of the reviews taking about the location. If you book hotels off Ramblas it would be expected it would be busy! Also the rooms are not the biggest but I doubt you will get much bigger in a city like Barcelona.

The market is also close by and they have loads of great options for breakfast l, lunch and dinner. Another great bar nearby is First Bar would recommend if you have the time.
data.title: Great stay

We also appreciate your kind words about the hotel's cleanliness and decor, as we strive to maintain a welcoming and aesthetically pleasing environment for all our guests. Your enjoyment of the room's air-conditioning is exactly the comfort we aim to provide after a day out in the city.
